body_html: @ezyang I think our current implementation for groups suppose that nInputPlanes is divisible by groups, so this change should be fine. But it is possible to extend the handling of groups to allow for different sized groups (5 planes, 2 groups, 3 and 2 in the groups), in which case the previous behaviour with the division is desired.
body_text: @ezyang I think our current implementation for groups suppose that nInputPlanes is divisible by groups, so this change should be fine. But it is possible to extend the handling of groups to allow for different sized groups (5 planes, 2 groups, 3 and 2 in the groups), in which case the previous behaviour with the division is desired.
body: @ezyang I think our current implementation for groups suppose that `nInputPlanes` is divisible by groups, so this change should be fine. But it is possible to extend the handling of groups to allow for different sized groups (5 planes, 2 groups, 3 and 2 in the groups), in which case the previous behaviour with the division is desired.
